Fix component names

Source: R/dim_reduction.R
fix_components_names.Rd

fix_components_names() fixes the names of the PCs in the PCA results. If number of PCs is higher than 10, the function will remove the zeros in front of the PC names (for example PC01 -> PC1).

Usage

fix_components_names(
  pca_res,
  components,
  by_sample,
  sample_id,
  var_name,
  type = "pca"
)

Arguments

pca_res

A tibble with the PCA results. Created by hd_pca().

components

The number of PCs to be calculated.

by_sample

If TRUE, points represent samples. If FALSE, points represent features.

sample_id

The name of the column in the data that contains the sample IDs.

var_name

The name of the column in the data that contains the feature IDs.

type

The type of analysis. Default is "pca".

Value

A tibble with the PCA results with fixed PC names.
